item.book.0.title: welcome
item.book.0.page.1: Thank you very much for downloading this world, "Britdenek 3.5-Lomia-".
item.book.0.page.2: For detailed settings, please see the readme file that is included with the data in the world.
item.book.0.page.3: So, where on earth is this...? Maybe it's a good idea to explore a little.
item.book.1.title: The creation god and the evil god
item.book.1.author: Imperio Publishing
item.book.1.page.1: There are gods called the creation gods and gods called the evil gods in this world. This book explains these gods.
item.book.1.page.2:
Denek
The creator god who rules the heavens and earth. Created Britodenek. He has the appearance of a muscular old man and has a gentle personality.
item.book.1.page.3:
Aera
The creator god who controls life. He created the whole life of Britodenek. She looks like a stunning beauty.
item.book.1.page.4:
Order
The creation god who controls order and time. He creates and manages Britodenek's order. He looks like a young man in armor.
item.book.1.page.5:
Beespear
An evil god who controls betrayal and despair. They instill doubt in humans and destroy human relationships. She looks like a simple woman and rules another world called Jewelland.
item.book.1.page.6:
Amorasac
The evil god who controls destruction. It causes disasters such as eruptions and floods. It looks like a winged gorilla and rules another world called the Armory.
item.book.1.page.7:
Racolondo
An evil god of fear and confusion. He creates traps using the souls of the dead and instills fear and confusion in the living. He appears as a human covered in magma and rules over a different world known as the Mad Garage.
item.book.1.page.8:
Resrect
The evil god who controls resurrection and immortality. Gives believers the power to revive living creatures on a whim. She looks like a four-armed woman and rules another world called Graveyard.
item.book.1.page.9:
Brezzuro
The evil god who controls pleasure and fall. They see through the lazy human mind and drag them into the swamp of desire. He is so beautiful that even men fall in love with him, he rules another world called Fall Island.
item.book.1.page.10:
Ruzekolap
The evil god who controls illness and darkness. It created all sorts of illnesses. She looks like an old woman with a staff and rules another world called the Dark Swamp or Venom Swamp.
item.book.2.title: The History of Britodenek
item.book.2.author: Imperio Publishing
item.book.2.page.1: The history of Britodenek can be divided into four categories: the beginning period, the construction period, the unborn period, and the divine period. This book explains what happened in these times.
item.book.2.page.2: Long before Britodenek was created, there was an empty space in the world. There were nine gods in the space. A God cooperated and proposed to create a world in that space. The two Gods agreed with the proposal, and the rest of them decided to create their own world.
item.book.2.page.3: And this world, Britodenek was created by the creator gods Denek, Aera, and Order. First Denek created the earth. Aera then planted the species of the creature in the ground. Finally, the order gave the world a chance to move. This was the beginning of Britodenek, and it continued for thousands of years.
item.book.2.page.4: When Britodenek was completed and the construction period entered, the gods created us humanity. Humanity worshiped the three gods, created a nation, and lived in harmony. Around this time, the remaining six gods also completed their own unique world, Realm.
item.book.2.page.5: However, the world created by the six gods was a world where there was something missing compared to Britodenek. The six jealous gods began to trouble with Britodenek's humanity. A god spread fear. A god spread the illness. As a result, the six gods became known as evil gods.
item.book.2.page.6: Angry at this, Denek, Aera and Oder attempt to protect Britodenek. Don't be out of control, the evil gods began an invasion of Britodenek. The conflict between the gods intensified, and in the end all of the gods died out. Later this war was called the divine war. This concludes the construction period with approximately 2,000 years of history.
item.book.2.page.7: After that, Britodenek was a period known as the bryonation period for about 800 years. Humanity somehow survived without God's protection. As a result, technical improvements in the creation of magic and tools, and a culture similar to ours today has been created.
item.book.2.page.8: Then, in the last year of the brink of confusion, an incident called the Fragment Warfare occurs. Amorasac, a god who was thought to have been perished, was resurrected and began an invasion of Britodenek. Fortunately, however, the fragment turmoil was halted by Tonem Gulf heroes.
item.book.2.page.9: After the fragmentary upheaval, Genesis revealed that all Gods were alive. And Genesis God rejoices in that humans live alone in their own power, and at the same time explains that God's blessing is not necessary. The brink of breach came to an end, promising to remove only the calamities that were plagued by the evil gods.
item.book.2.page.10: Since then, strangers who have washed away from illnesses and realms have continued to be removed by the Genesis God. If you become ill, you will be cured immediately by praying to the Genesis God in the church.
item.book.2.page.11: It has now been about 200 years since the beginning of the Theocene period, and I hope that Britdenek will continue to thrive in the future.
item.book.3.title: Fragment Dictionary (Volume 1)
item.book.3.author: Author unknown
item.book.3.page.1: The mythical war caused great damage to gods and humans. In this war we were tormented by the weapon fragments of the evil gods. I would like to leave the memories of the abominable fragments in this book and pass them on to future generations. I hope that your juniors will use this book when they come back in the future.
item.book.3.page.2:
Krosis
The end of the priest who served Amorasac. Fight with nature such as ice and thunder as your allies. A simple man who likes to fight against strong people. If we can launch a smash attack, we might have a chance to win.
item.book.3.page.3:
Brunik
A insidious man who likes traps, symmetrically with Krosis. Apparently he originally served Romia's god of disaster, but his insidious personality made him a fragment of Luzekolap. He uses troublesome traps and illusional magic, but if he breaks it he won't be a big opponent.
item.book.3.page.4:
Bahaus
An immortal demon dragon created by Amorasac. He is weak because he was designed to bring about destruction. I'll get on the provocation right away, so if I create an opening I might be able to deal with it. Be careful as the power of destruction is real.
item.book.3.page.5:
Dinok
The man who is said to be a vampire first created by Reslect. He uses a variety of techniques besides blood sucking, such as manipulating corpses and transforming into bats. He is a very troublesome being, but if he can lure him to a place with sunlight and the cross, he will be able to somehow defeat him by himself.
item.book.3.page.6:
Divon
A tentacle creature that is said to have been created by Luze Colap. It absorbs living things and inorganic matters regardless of whether they are living things or inorganic things, and grows to a massive extent. However, his intelligence was low and the evil gods seemed to be having trouble dealing with them. Apparently it is usually sealed somewhere in the desert of the Thia region.
item.book.3.page.7:
Agnax
A fragment born when an evil god gives power to a spirit that lived in primitive volcanoes. It is a snake-like monster with a magma-like head and a tail of flame, and it flies through the air and attacks humans. It's a flame monster, so there's no guarantee that, but water may be his weakness.
item.book.3.page.8:
Armored Squid
Apparently Lacolondo is a modified version of a giant squid. It appears to be made using a technology that does not exist in Britodenek, and each attack is strange.
It seems that it can only appear in the sea, so it's not a problem as long as you don't get close to the sea.
item.book.3.page.9:
Hadrim
The immortal demon dragon born after Bahaus by Amorasak. Compared to Bahaus, it was a very troublesome fragment. However, a gentle dragon chose to reconcile with humans. During the reconciliation, we told humans that the base of the fingers on the hand was a weakness.
item.book.4.title: Realm Exploration Volume 1
item.book.4.author: Philip Elster
item.book.4.page.1: A realm, a world created by the evil god. It is considered to be an unknown world that is different from Britodenek, and all of them are said to be the worst environment for humans. However, it is also said that there is something valuable that cannot be obtained at Britodenek.
item.book.4.page.2: For example, it is said that there are Karakuri dolls in Lacolonde's Realm and Mad Garage that cannot be created using Britodenek's technology. For example, the realm of Luze Collup, the Darkswamp, is said to have a jewel that can cure any disease.
item.book.4.page.3: As an adventurer who seeks the unknown, there is something that piques my curiosity. Convinced that, I vowed to go on an adventure to become a realm.
item.book.4.page.4: Our first destination was the realm of Amorasac, Armory. It's not easy to go to the realm. However, I had a sense of how to get to Armory. I headed to Tonem Gulf, a town famous for being a land of fragment turmoil.
item.book.5.title: Marbenon's Mystery
item.book.5.author: Armin Otomeier
item.book.5.page.1: It is said that humanity was born in Britodenek at the beginning of the construction period, and as the runner-up in the 204 period of the Kamisei era, humanity was said to have flourished for about 3,000 years. However, in Marbeon, a jungle-closed land, something strange has been discovered that could overturn this history.
item.book.5.page.2: Ruins made of white quartz were discovered in a cave that was accidentally discovered while building a new town in Marbenon. There are many creepy and strange things in this ruin.
item.book.5.page.3: First, let's talk about architecture using white quartz. Processing white quartz is extremely difficult, and in the last 100 years or so, technology has finally been established to make it into accessories. Despite this, the site uses white quartz as its building material.
item.book.5.page.4: Furthermore, according to literature written at the beginning of the construction period, there were jungles around the Marbenon ruins from that time, and although there were tribes that hunted nuts and animals, no advanced civilization existed.
item.book.5.page.5: When this site was discovered, the inside of the site was occupied by goblins. Could the goblins have built this sophisticated civilization? Some were long before the construction period...for example, did a civilization already exist in the early days than it is now? The mystery only deepens.
item.book.6.title: Fragment Disturbance
item.book.6.author: Tonem Gulf Publishing
item.book.6.page.1: In the last year of the era of breach, the God of Genesis was resurrected. At that time, the God of Genesis was told that the evil god was active. He then revealed the existence of the hero who fought for Britodenek. This story is about an unnamed hero who fought alone against a resurrected evil god.
item.book.6.page.2: In his last year of unbornness, a man was captured in prison in Tonem Gulf. It is said that only Duke Latrond, Duke of Tonemgulf at the time, was known to him. The Duke of Latrond gives a certain mission on the condition that the prisoner is released. The mission is to destroy the weapon fragments used by the evil gods in mythological warfare.
item.book.6.page.3: The prisoner agreed to this mission and upon his release he headed to a place called the ancient catacomb. There he fights against the end of the priest called Crosis. He fought bravely with his sacred treasures from the Mythic War era, which had been sealed in the catacombs. The fierce battle shattered the sacred treasures, but the prisoners successfully defeated Crosis.
item.book.6.page.4: He then defeats the warrior Brunik, who was sealed in the forest of corpses, the demon dragon Bahaus, who was sealed in the scars of the earth, the vampire king Dinok, who was sleeping in the witch's hideout, the tentacle creature Divon, who was sealed in an abandoned desert, and the ancient spirit Agnax, who was imprisoned in a primitive volcano.
item.book.6.page.5: And the Duke of Latrond orders him to fight Amorasac, the king of destruction, as the final condition for the prisoners to be completely free. The man was dressed in Kongagulite armor and used his numerous Noble Phantasms, swords and intelligence to defeat Amorasac. The prisoners will then be told as heroes of Tonem Gulf in later life.
item.book.6.page.6: However, no one knows what's going on. The Duke and the Hero disappeared after this battle. Now I don't know where he went or why he disappeared from the city without telling anyone. The author of this book speculates that the Duke of Latrond, fearing power, was attempting to assassinate the Tonemgulf heroes in a bid.
item.book.6.page.7: In this book, the hero of Tonem Gulf is considered a man, but it is not known at all whether he was actually a woman or how old he was. This story is also reproduced based on fragmentary information obtained from the townspeople of Tonemgulf after the resurrection of the God of Genesis. In any case, the truth is in the darkness.
item.book.7.title: Third Gods
item.book.7.author: Meera Baro
item.book.7.page.1: The God of Genesis who created Britodenek, and the evil god who frequently threatens Britodenek. Many people believe that there are only two types of gods in the world. However, there is a god in the frontier of Britodenek that does not belong to either of these gods. This book introduces such gods.
item.book.7.page.2:
Romia's God of Disaster
A god worshiped in Romia, a desert town in the Thia region southwest of Britdenek. The official name was forgotten in ancient times. He once worried about people who had forgotten himself, he committed an incident in which all the people in the city were taken away at Romire, during the construction period. From then on, he has been worshiped as the guardian deity of Romia.
item.book.7.page.3:
Steio
A god of knowledge worshiped in the Primara region of the east of Britodenek. He is a purely exploring knowledge, and seems to have no interest in anything other than to acquire new knowledge. He originally seemed to have been a human scholar who was enthusiastic about research, but after being caught up in the war of divine exploits and died, he became like a earthbound spirit, and it seems to have continued to this day.
item.book.7.page.4: Romia's god of disaster and Steio are indigenous gods worshiped in the provinces. However, the gods introduced on the following pages only have names in old books, and there is little information about what their properties have. Perhaps he is the god of fantasy thought up by ancient people.
item.book.7.page.5:
Rumo
The god who controls light. The name was listed in a book discovered at the beginning of the construction period, that is, immediately after the birth of humanity. The book does not exist, but if true, it means that before humans were born, there existed an organism that could manipulate the same language as in modern times. Or was the book written by God?
item.book.7.page.6:
Marspelo
The god who controls darkness. His name was listed in the same book as Rumo. These two pillars are said to control light and darkness, but perhaps they have the power to far surpass the God of Genesis and the evil gods? Despite this, its existence has not been confirmed. The mystery only deepens.
item.book.8.title: Lost myth adventure
item.book.8.author: Author unknown
item.book.8.page.1: There was a desert desert village. There were fields in the village, but no crops grew. There was a well, but it was about to die. The villagers were in trouble, but they refused to abandon the village.
item.book.8.page.2: One day, one of the villagers found a man lying near the village. The man groaned in a low voice. There was almost no water in the village anymore, but the villagers gave the man all the remaining water.
item.book.8.page.3: The man, who was feeling well, said he wanted to give back to the village. However, the villager informed the village of the current situation and encouraged the man to leave the village immediately. Then the man began to put Karakuri, which he had never seen before, all across the village. As the tactile movements, crops grew in the village fields and water erupted in the wells.
item.book.8.page.4: The man stayed in the village for a while, enriching the village with techniques that he had never seen or worked. The village has grown to a size that could be called a small town. And after a while the village became a town, the man disappeared.
item.book.8.page.5: A while later something strange happened in the city. Lightning struck once a day, and the residents were taken away one by one. And there was no one inhabitant in the town.
item.book.8.page.6: There were no people in the city, but there were some excellent creatures left by the man. In order to regain the kidnapped master, they took people into the city by "a certain means"...
item.book.9.title: To the dear god's blessing
item.book.9.author: Author unknown
item.book.9.page.1: There was one thing I forgot to mention! This world is a little different to the world you were in before, so let me know!
item.book.9.page.2: First, let's talk about the Ender Chest. Ender chests in this world are used to select skills rather than storing items! Easy to use! Simply put the skills you want to use from the Ender chest into the skill slot!
item.book.9.page.3: Also, there are slots in this world that are equipped with decorations called rings and necklaces. It's best to use it ingenuity!
item.book.9.page.4: Oh! And I should explain about magic! There are magic in this world, and you can use it by using Noble Phantasm and Wand! Hold the Noble Phantasm in the main hand and the wand in the offhand and right-click! Don't make the wrong left and right?
item.book.9.page.5: There are also many other things you might not know, such as a sickle or a knife, but then you can do some research yourself! You've been trying and error! I wish you good luck!

system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.1: <???> Oh, oh... doesn't it smell like a mortal?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.2: <???> It's a daredevil mortal who sneaks into my realm!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.3: <???> How did you get in? Tell me! Reckless challenger
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.4: <???> No, wait... are you... the blessing of the Outside God?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.5: <???> Good! It's fine if you don't say it! It's the atmosphere that makes you feel it!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.6: <???> How many years have you been with the guest of the Blessed? Or maybe a few months?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.7: <???> Well, that doesn't matter! They're a guest! They have to be hospitality!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.8: <???> That's right! I was just thinking about a fun and fun game!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.9: <???> Bloody meat dancing makes your neck blow... the best game!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.10: <???> Look at this guy before explaining the rules of the game.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.11: <???> This is Romia, the oasis city that continues to miraculously exist in the desert of death.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.12: <???> This city has flourished despite being in the desert of death, with the power of a wonderful god that everyone worships.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.13: <???> But even so! The mortals in this town have cheated on the god of disgusting!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.14: <???> I gave such blessings! Despite being satisfied!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.15: <???> So I came up with the idea of making this city the venue for my next game!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.16: <???> And the title of this game is... the Hero's Trial!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.17: <???> The town's residents are kidnapped by a mysterious being, and strangers visit the end of their trouble.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.18: <???> The stranger kindly stands up for the city and takes on the challenge to help the kidnapped residents!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.19: <???> And the outsider will eventually be recognized by the town's residents, and eventually worshiped as heroes!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.20: <???> What do you think? It's not a bad story for you too, isn't it? A stranger!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.21: <???> Trials are divided into five levels, from A to E, and the closer you get to A, the more difficult it becomes.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.22: <???> If you clear three E-rank trials, you can take on the D-rank trials.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.23: <???> Repeat this challenge and clear three A-rank trials and the hero will be born!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.24: <???> The place of the trial is an fantasy arena! You can understand the location without explaining it! Probably!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.25: <???> So... a merciless, brave stranger who challenges the ordeal...
system.talk.lomia.event.main.1.talk.27: <???> If you die quickly, you'll be excited... Let it be fun?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.2.talk.2: <???> This is the first test I am happy to pass!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.2.talk.4: <???> Even if you achieve it, you'll lose motivation if you don't get a reward... right?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.2.talk.5: <???> So I've returned a few mortals to the city.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.2.talk.6: <???> I'm looking forward to seeing their reactions?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.2.talk.7: <???> I'll try to do my next challenge with this
system.talk.lomia.event.main.3.talk.3: <???> He is truly a blessing to the Outside God!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.3.talk.4: <???> It's understandable that mortals praise you as a hero
system.talk.lomia.event.main.3.talk.5: <???> By the way... Apparently there are things that can be gamble in this town.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.3.talk.6: <???> Don't get too hooked and forget about the ordeal...?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.4.talk.2: <???> He is truly a blessing to the Outside God!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.4.talk.3: <???> It's so amazing that I think it's okay to make it my follower!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.4.talk.4: <???> No, but is it still too early?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.4.talk.5: <???> My favorite mortal once outscored Amora Sac's idiot...
system.talk.lomia.event.main.4.talk.6: <???> So you're still a little silly!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.4.talk.7: <???> So, can chicks grow into chickens...?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.5.talk.1: <???> That's good! That's how it goes!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.5.talk.2: <???> I was not in my eyes as expected!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.5.talk.3: <???> He's quite capable as a mortal.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.5.talk.4: <???> If I'm feeling this way, I wonder if I can easily complete my final trial?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.5.talk.5: <???> Don't worry! It's easier than defeating an angry evil god or swearing a child who has become a monster from a mad mother!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.5.talk.6: <???> Will the chickens that have grown safely be able to go home alive...?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.1: <???> Chicken has evolved into a dragon!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.3: <???> I never thought they would defeat a disaster that would destroy the city!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.5: <???> I wonder when I was so surprised...
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.6: <???> Yes... since yesterday when I drank coffee and thought it was tea
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.7: <???> Well, as promised, you have survived the trial! You have to keep your promise!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.8: <???> All mortals have been returned to the city.
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.9: <???> Now you're a hero of the city!
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.10: <???> But you're probably going to get carried away at this level, right?
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.11: <???> This is just the beginning of the party
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.12: <???> A party that may never come in one or two years...
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.13: <???> It's been a while since then
system.talk.lomia.event.main.6.talk.15: <???> Oh, and I've left behind some secret trials so if you're OK, please play with me☆

system.talk.lomia.npc1.event0.2: <Automaton Cook> We sell rare foods around the world~
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event0.1: <Automaton Farmer> Oh well... I wonder what another Romia thing is going to happen again...
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event0.2: <Automaton Farmer> Has it been a thousand years now? It's been a while since I last died...
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event0.3: <Automaton Farmer> I feel like the demo has a slightly different atmosphere than last time.
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event1.1: <Automaton Farmer> Well, no matter what, my job won't change.
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event1.2: <Automaton Farmer> Cultivating vegetables for human sun~
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event2.2: <Automaton Farmer> Bad insect sun is exterminated
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event6.1: <Automaton Farmer> It seems like something strange has finally ended
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event6.2: <Automaton Farmer> Your master is also a tsundere, so it's a problem.
system.talk.lomia.npc2.event6.3: <Automaton Farmer> What? Oh, did you just hear it? I don't want to just talk to myself~
system.talk.lomia.npc5.event3.2: <Automaton Night> This coin is necessary for watching the arena!
system.talk.lomia.npc3.event3.2: <Automaton Smith> There are various types of armor
system.talk.lomia.npc3.event4.1: <Automaton Smith> I've increased my repertoire of Dake armor a little.
system.talk.lomia.npc3.event4.2: <Automaton Smith> The more you use good protective gear, the easier it will be to fight.
system.talk.lomia.npc3.event5.1: <Automaton Smith> Master San's addictiveness, Jitta Jitta!
system.talk.lomia.npc3.event5.2: <Automaton Smith> Make even better armor with this
system.talk.lomia.npc4.event3.2: <Automaton Dealer> Slot Ree Machine and Mystery Box are in operation!
system.talk.lomia.npc4.event3.3: <Automaton Dealer> Both are easy to play! Just put three coins in and press the switch!
system.talk.lomia.npc4.event3.4: <Automaton Dealer> If you win, you will receive a lot of coins!
system.talk.lomia.npc4.event3.6: <Automaton Dealer> It seems that Death, who is not very clear, is somehow a bit of a person around the arena who barters coins.
system.talk.lomia.npc4.event3.7: <Automaton Dealer> All that's left is to exchange everything for prizes in the Mystery Box!
system.talk.lomia.npc6.event0.2: <Automaton Trader> I have nothing to do with Me Casino, but I'm exchanging coins and items!
system.talk.lomia.npc7.event0.2: <Automaton Trader> Our store's minerals can be both weapons and armor~
system.talk.lomia.npc8.event2.1: <Automaton Owner> Thank you so much for your hard work!
system.talk.lomia.npc8.event2.3: <Automaton Owner> The mechanics have disappeared, so the casinos are still not open
system.talk.lomia.npc8.event3.1: <Automaton Owner> Romia Casino is open today and is still in business!
system.talk.lomia.npc8.event3.2: <Automaton Owner> Please follow your dreams and play with Janjan!
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event2.1: <Luisa> Thanks to you, I've come back! Thank you so much!
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event2.3: <Luisa> Where are you starting? Hmm...I don't really know either...
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event2.4: <Luisa> How... it feels like you've dreamed of it?
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event3.1: <Luisa> But this city is pretty dangerous...
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event3.2: <Luisa> Yes! Star syrup! I wonder why star syrup is so popular...
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event3.3: <Luisa> It's probably because of the sandstorm, so I might do some research too...?
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event3.4: <Luisa> First off, I start with the Elder...I feel that person is somehow suspicious...
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event4.2: <Luisa> I see it as a crappy merchant.
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event4.3: <Luisa> He seems to be on good terms with the elders, so there's definitely something about this.
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event5.1: <Luisa> That Pisarro was such a nice person!
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event5.2: <Luisa> No... my intuition is disappointing... so embarrassing
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event5.3: <Luisa> All that's left is to bring back the people in town.
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event5.4: <Luisa> I think I'll have to earn the money to go and find my sister soon...
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event5.5: <Luisa> Hmm? Ah, it's nothing! Just talking to yourself!
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event6.1: <Luisa> That Pisarro was such a nice person!
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event6.2: <Luisa> No... my intuition is disappointing... so embarrassing
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event6.3: <Luisa> Hmm, the star syrup epidemic has probably stopped, so everything will be solved!
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event6.4: <Luisa> Anyway, I guess I have to earn the money to go and find my sister...
system.talk.lomia.npc11.event6.5: <Luisa> Hmm? Ah, it's nothing! Just talking to yourself!
system.talk.lomia.npc12.event2.2: <Hayate> But... I think if I had fought, I could have saved everyone sooner.
system.talk.lomia.npc12.event2.3: <Hayate> What? So you should do from here onwards?
system.talk.lomia.npc12.event2.4: <Hayate> That's what I thought! But even if I try to enter that gate, I'll be hit...
system.talk.lomia.npc12.event3.2: <Hayate> You might be able to use my hometown sword skills as well.
system.talk.lomia.npc12.event3.3: <Hayate> Should I learn it if you like?
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event0.1: <Nav> It seems there was a loud noise outside, has something happened?
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event0.2: <Nav> What?! The people in town suddenly disappeared!?
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event0.3: <Nav> I'm worried about Nanna and Elena... I have to go and look for them...
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event1.2: <Nav> However, it's only time that you have to work at times like this.
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event1.3: <Nav> Are you looking for food or a drink?
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event3..2: <Nav> It seems you brought the two back!
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event3..3: <Nav> If you like, please use the second floor and the basement room.
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event3..4: <Nav> I'm sure the fight will be a little easier.
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event3.2: <Nav> The city is slowly returning to its original state
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event4..1: <Nav> Nanna and Elena are actually addicted to star syrup...
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event4..2: <Nav> I want to stop it somehow, but what should I do...
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event4.1: <Nav> Thanks to you, Nanna and Elena have stopped star syrup!
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event4.2: <Nav> Thank you so much! These girls will be able to pay off their debts little by little.
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event6.1: <Nav> Thanks to you, the city has returned to normal!
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event6.2: <Nav> What's more, Nanna and Elena were able to stop drinking that drink too!
system.talk.lomia.npc13.event6.3: <Nav> What do you need? The Hero of Romia!
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event0.1: <Logan> There was a sound like something...
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event0.2: <Logan> Well, if you leave it to the store's Kota Automata, it's safe~
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event1.2: <Logan> Ah... I can't help but feel tired...
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event1.3: <Logan> Is it a weapon? There are a lot of things
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event4.1: <Logan> Thanks to you, I've stopped drinking that damn alcohol
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event4.2: <Logan> I wonder why he ended up dabbling something so scary...
system.talk.lomia.npc14.event4.3: <Logan> Oops, do you need a weapon?
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event0.1: <Josee> Hi...!? Pisarro sniffs in front of him and disappears with lightning...!?
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event0.2: <Josee> What a thing...just like the old story...
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event0.3: <Josee> It's the re-appearance of the god of disaster...!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event0.4: <Josee> This must be all because of that damn alcohol!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event0.5: <Josee> Ah... God of disaster... Please mercy...!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event1.1: <Josee> Traveler, you came to Romire at the worst time...
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event1.2: <Josee> Even though I want to escape from the god of disaster, Romia is currently in the sandstorm season, so I can't go outside...
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event1.3: <Josee> What's more, the automata have been erased from this disaster...
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event1.4: <Josee> Pisarro has disappeared, and it's the worst possible situation I can imagine...
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event1.5: <Josee> Ah... God of disaster... Please mercy...!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event4.1: <Josee> Traveler! Thank you! Pissarro has returned!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event4.2: <Josee> In fact, Pisarro was an old friend from my magical college days.
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event4.3: <Josee> They were coming to us to do something about star syrup, which is rampant in this city!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event4.4: <Josee> Pissarro is now a top-class merchant, but he is also top-class when it comes to making potions!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event4.5: <Josee> But he's a little troubled at the moment
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event4.6: <Josee> Would you like to hear Pissarro's request?
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event5.3: <Josee> Be sure to take your time sightseeing.
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event6.1: <Josee> I managed to get that damn liquor!
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event6.2: <Josee> Traveler! Sorry, but please take the rest of the townspeople back.
system.talk.lomia.npc16.event6.3: <Josee> Once that's over, please take your time sightseeing.
system.talk.lomia.npc17.event3..2: <Nanna> Hey! If I had a star syrup or a coin, wouldn't it give me?
system.talk.lomia.npc17.event4..1: <Nanna> Oh, come visit us a traveler ♡
system.talk.lomia.npc17.event4..2: <Nanna> Thanks to you, I've stopped star syrup and gambling!
system.talk.lomia.npc17.event4..3: <Nanna> I can't thank Nav and you enough! Thank you so much!
system.talk.lomia.npc18.event3..1: <Elena> Star Syrup Star Syrup Star Syrup...
system.talk.lomia.npc18.event3..3: (Elena has blank eyes... Let's leave it alone)
system.talk.lomia.npc18.event4..2: <Elena> Ugh... I was seen a lot of embarrassing things...
system.talk.lomia.npc18.event4..3: <Elena> I wonder why I made Star Syrup... I can't remember...
system.talk.lomia.npc18.event4..4: <Elena> Thank you so much... Without you, I would have been on the verge of my life...!
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event2.1: <Aslan> I've seen you do well! That's amazing!
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event2.2: <Aslan> It felt like I was watching the God-End War right in front of my eyes.
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event2.3: <Aslan> Well, that's the case, but we have to investigate this strange situation.
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event2.4: <Aslan> Hmm...the strange thing is very similar to what is written in Lost myth adventure...but...
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event3.1: <Aslan> Ah! There's too much to research!
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event3.2: <Aslan> What, did you come and see the book?
system.talk.lomia.npc19.event3.3: <Aslan> There are a lot, but which one should I choose?
system.talk.lomia.npc20.event6.2: <Albus> Star syrup is God's mercy that saves this world!
system.talk.lomia.npc20.event6.4: <Albus> This is Lord Hero... It seems that what I did was become addicted to Star Syrup...
system.talk.lomia.npc20.event6.5: <Albus> What a blunder, despite being in a position to serve the God of Romia...
system.talk.lomia.npc20.event6.6: <Albus> But... for some reason I can't remember why I became addicted to Star Syrup... Hmm...
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event0.3: <Lign> Has someone disappeared? What are you saying stupid things?
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event0.4: <Lign> There's no choice... I'll go outside a little bit.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event1.1: <Lign> I thought that Romia's god of disaster was a fairy tale.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event1.2: <Lign> Even I was surprised when I was confident that I wouldn't be surprised at most things.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event2.1: <Lign> Apparently people have come back a little bit.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event2.2: <Lign> Is it because of you? Thank you
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event4.1: <Lign> It looks like the city's vibrancy has returned to its fullest.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event5.1: <Lign> Apparently there are only a few people who haven't returned to town yet.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event5.2: <Lign> Please use my items to help the rest of the people.
system.talk.lomia.npc21.event6.1: <Lign> Thanks to you, the city is back to normal!
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.2: <Pissarro> But Jose, after the spread of Starsyrup, it's not like Romia's re-emergence of the god of disaster?
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.3: <Pisarro> Well, thanks to this, I think I can do a lot of interesting things... Guhuh...
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.4: <Pissarro> It's pretty bold that you're trying to save this city on your own! Don't you hate it?
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.5: <Pissarro> So! I have one request to expect you.
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.6: <Pissarro> I want to make a certain chemical to stop the spread of star syrup in this city, but I don't have enough ingredients.
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.7: <Pissarro> Can you bring me the ingredients there?
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.8: <Pissarro> The material is a piece of artifact that contains the power of the creator or evil god.
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.9: <Pissarro> Artifacts aren't broken because they just use some of the magical power.
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.10: <Pissarro> For the future of this city! Please? Guhuh...
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.11: <Pissarro> Oh...! Did you bring it! I'll do it!
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.12: <Pissarro> Let me share the magical power of the artifact a little.
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.13: <Pissarro> Guhuhu... Now you can make all the earth drops...
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.14: <Pissarro> From here onwards, it's my job and Jose! Leave it to me! Guhuh...
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.15: <Pissarro> Guhuhu... Star syrup is no longer scary now
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event4.16: <Pissarro> And then, if you bring back the city's residents, the city will be completely restored.
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event6.1: <Pissarro> The city is completely peaceful now!
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event6.2: <Pissarro> So, will I go sightseeing until the sandstorm season ends before returning to Imperio?
system.talk.lomia.npc22.event6.3: <Pissarro> Please let me know? Jose! Guhuhu...
system.talk.lomia.npc23.event6.2: <Diabolo> Now, traveler! Let's have a toast with this too!
system.talk.lomia.npc23.event6.3: <Diabolo> Even if you don't say no now, I'll be toasting in a while anyway! Hahahaha!
system.talk.lomia.npc24.event6.2: <Mark> This alcohol is delicious too, right?
system.talk.lomia.npc24.event6.4: <Mark> Ghh... I have a headache... I have to thank Lord Pisarro...
system.talk.lomia.npc24.event6.5: <Mark> But... I'm addicted to star syrup... I don't remember drinking it...
system.talk.lomia.npc24.event6.6: <Mark> I remember when I was sightseeing in this town, I was surrounded by pink fog... yeah...
system.talk.lomia.npc25.event1.1: <Automaton Mask> Welcome to the Gensou Shop!
system.talk.lomia.npc25.event1.2: <Automaton Mask> Our products are only visible to those with the right talent and can be purchased.
